result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Steven Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Portage County Case No. 15CF451.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment to victims.  If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with K. Trzebiatowski directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communcation or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Portage County Case No. 15CF451.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 02:50 PM Defendant Maurice Steven Harper in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Zamzow. No statement by DE. Court orders: 6 year term of imprisonment consecutive to any other sentence currently being served to include but not limited to Portage County Case No. 15CF451 - Bifurcated sentence - 2 years IC/4 years ES - No CFTS - ES Conditions: NC w/ K. Trzebiatowski, AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
